akn:section.akn:heading: Sergeant at Arms of House; additional compensation

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 5601. Sergeant at Arms of House; additional compensation The Sergeant at Arms of the House of Representatives shall receive, directly or indirectly, no fees or other compensation or emolument whatever for performing the duties of the office, or in connection therewith, otherwise than the salary prescribed by law. (June 20, 1874, ch. 328, 18 Stat. 87.)
Editorial Notes Codification Section was formerly classified to section 77 of this title prior to editorial reclassification and renumbering as this section.
Statutory Notes and Related Subsidiaries Similar ProvisionsProvisions similar to those in this section were also contained in act Mar. 3, 1875, ch. 129, 18 Stat. 346.
